title: American_Top_40_1987_September_5th
description:
"We're counting down the biggest hits in the land and the hits don't stop till we reach the top."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

As of this broadcast:

There is a band in the countdown that holds the record for the longest time (17 years) between first hitting the hot 100 and finally making the top 40 with their latest song.
	
There is only woman to ever hit the top ten on the Pop, Soul, Dance, and Country charts. She is in this countdown.

The most common girl's name ever to be featured in top 40 song titles is in this countdown.

Casey gives an AT40 report on snakes, because the band Whitesnake has a hit in the countdown.

L.L. Cool J has his first top 40 hit at number 18, "I Need Love," and Dan Hill (Sometimes When We Touch) is back in the top 40 (at number 7) for the first time since 1978.

Casey announces the title of every song on the chart except for, "I Want Your Sex" by George Michael, at number 19.

As of this countdown there is a song in the top ten that is over 300-years-old.
